items.name: Ext.selection.CellModel
allowDeselect
items.text: Allow users to deselect a record in a DataView, List or Grid. Only applicable when the mode is 'SINGLE'.

items.name: enableKeyNav
items.text: Turns on/off keyboard navigation within the grid.

items.name: ignoreRightMouseSelection
items.text:
True to ignore selections that are made when using the right mouse button if there are
records that are already selected. If no records are selected, selection will continue
as normal

items.name: listeners
mode
items.text:
Mode of selection.  Valid values are:

- **"SINGLE"** - Only allows selecting one item at a time. This is the default.

items.name: preventWrap
items.text:
Set this configuration to true to prevent wrapping around of selection as
a user navigates to the first or last column.

items.name: pruneRemoved
items.text: Remove records from the selection when they are removed from the store. **Important:** When using Ext.toolbar.Paging or a Ext.data.BufferedStore, records which are cached in the Store's Ext.data.Store#property-data may be removed from the Store when pages change, or when rows are scrolled out of view. For this reason pruneRemoved should be set to `false` when using a buffered Store. Also, when previously pruned pages are returned to the cache, the records objects in the page will be *new instances*, and will not match the instances in the selection model's collection. For this reason, you MUST ensure that the Model definition's Ext.data.Model#idProperty references a unique key because in this situation, records in the Store have their **IDs** compared to records in the SelectionModel in order to re-select a record which is scrolled back into view.

items.name: selected
items.text: The Ext.util.Collection to use as the collection of selected records.

items.name: store
items.text: The Ext.data.Store in which this selection model represents the selected subset.

items.name: toggleOnClick
items.text: `true` to toggle the selection state of an item when clicked. Only applicable when the mode is 'SINGLE'. Only applicable when the allowDeselect is 'true'.

items.name: beforedeselect
items.text:
Fired before a record is deselected. If any listener returns false, the
deselection is cancelled.

items.name: record
items.text: The deselected record.

items.name: index
items.text: The index within the store of the deselected record.

items.name: beforeselect
items.text:
Fired before a record is selected. If any listener returns false, the
selection is cancelled.

items.name: record
items.text: The selected record.

items.name: index
items.text: The index within the store of the selected record.

items.name: deselect
items.text: Fired after a cell is deselected

items.name: record
items.text: The record of the deselected cell

items.name: row
items.text: The row index deselected

items.name: column
items.text: The column index deselected

items.name: focuschange
items.text: Fired when a row is focused

items.name: oldFocused
items.text: The previously focused record

items.name: newFocused
items.text: The newly focused record

items.name: select
items.text: Fired after a cell is selected

items.name: record
items.text: The record of the selected cell

items.name: row
items.text: The row index selected

items.name: column
items.text: The column index selected

items.name: selectionchange
items.text: Fired after a selection change has occurred

items.name: selected
items.text: The selected records

items.name: _addDeclaredListeners
items.text: Adds declarative listeners as nested arrays of listener objects.
`true` if any listeners were added

items.name: addAfterListener
items.text: Alias for onAfter.

items.name: addBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for onBefore.

items.name: addListener
eventName
items.text:
The name of the event to listen for.
May also be an object who's property names are event names.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes or the *name* of the method within the specified `scope`. Will be called with arguments given to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent plus the `options` parameter described below.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text:
An object containing handler configuration.

**Note:** The options object will also be passed as the last argument to every
event handler.

This object may contain any of the following properties:

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is executed. **If omitted,
  defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: delay
items.text:
The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event
  fires.

items.name: single
items.text:
True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove
  itself.

items.name: buffer
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is _not_ invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

items.name: onFrame
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run at the next Ext.Function#requestAnimationFrame. If the event fires again before that time, the handler is not rescheduled - the handler will only be called once when the next animation frame is fired, with the last set of arguments passed.

items.name: target
items.text:
Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Observable, _not_ if the
  event was bubbled up from a child Observable.

items.name: element
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.Component.** The name of a Component property which references an Ext.dom.Element to add a listener to. This option is useful during Component construction to add DOM event listeners to elements of Ext.Component which will exist only after the Component is rendered. For example, to add a click listener to a Panel's body: var panel = new Ext.panel.Panel({ title: 'The title', listeners: { click: this.handlePanelClick, element: 'body' } }); In order to remove listeners attached using the element, you'll need to reference the element itself as seen below. panel.body.un(...)

items.name: delegate
items.text:
A simple selector to filter the event target or look for a descendant of the target.

  The "delegate" option is only available on Ext.dom.Element instances (or
  when attaching a listener to a Ext.dom.Element via a Component using the
  element option).

  See the *delegate* example below.

items.name: stopPropagation
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopPropagation on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: preventDefault
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#preventDefault on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: stopEvent
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopEvent on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: args
items.text: Optional arguments to pass to the handler function. Any additional arguments passed to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent will be appended to these arguments.

items.name: destroyable
items.text: When specified as `true`, the function returns a `destroyable` object. An object which implements the `destroy` method which removes all listeners added in this call. This syntax can be a helpful shortcut to using un; particularly when removing multiple listeners. *NOTE* - not compatible when using the _element_ option. See un for the proper syntax for removing listeners added using the _element_ config.

items.name: priority
items.text:
An optional numeric priority that determines the order in which event handlers
  are run. Event handlers with no priority will be run as if they had a priority
  of 0. Handlers with a higher priority will be prioritized to run sooner than
  those with a lower priority.  Negative numbers can be used to set a priority
  lower than the default. Internally, the framework uses a range of 1000 or
  greater, and -1000 or lesser for handlers that are intended to run before or
  after all others, so it is recommended to stay within the range of -999 to 999
  when setting the priority of event handlers in application-level code.
  A priority must be an integer to be valid.  Fractional values are reserved for
  internal framework use.

items.name: order
items.text:
A legacy option that is provided for backward compatibility.
  It is recommended to use the `priority` option instead.  Available options are:

  - `'before'`: equal to a priority of `100`
  - `'current'`: equal to a priority of `0` or default priority
  - `'after'`: equal to a priority of `-100`

items.name: order
addManagedListener
item
items.text: The item to which to add a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event
name, this is the handler function or the name of a method on the specified
`scope`.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: options
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the Ext.util.Observable#addListener options.

items.name: beforeViewRender
items.text:
Allows multiple views to be controlled by one selection model.
Called by AbstractView's beforeRender method.

items.name: view
items.text: The View passes itself

items.name: bindStore
items.text: Binds a store to this instance.

items.name: store
items.text: The store to bind or ID of the store. When no store given (or when null or undefined passed), unbinds the existing store.

items.name: bindStoreListeners
items.text:
Binds listeners for this component to the store. By default it will add
anything bound by the getStoreListeners method, however it can be overridden
in a subclass to provide any more complicated handling.

items.name: store
items.text: The store to bind to

items.name: clearListeners
items.text: Removes all listeners for this object including the managed listeners

items.name: clearManagedListeners
items.text: Removes all managed listeners for this object.

items.name: clearSelections
items.text:
A fast reset of the selections without firing events, updating the ui, etc.
For private usage only.

items.name: createRelayer
items.text: Creates an event handling function which re-fires the event from this object as the passed event name.

items.name: newName
items.text: The name under which to re-fire the passed parameters.

items.name: beginEnd
items.text: (optional) The caller can specify on which indices to slice.

items.name: deselect
items.text: Deselects a record instance by record instance or index.

items.name: records
items.text: An array of records or an index

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: True to not fire a deselect event

items.name: deselectAll
items.text: Deselects all records in the view.

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: True to suppress any deselect events

items.name: deselectRange
items.text: Deselects a range of rows if the selection model isLocked.

items.name: startRow
items.text: The record or index of the first row in the range

items.name: endRow
items.text: The record or index of the last row in the range

items.name: doFireEvent
items.text: Continue to fire event.

items.name: enableBubble
eventNames
items.text: The event name to bubble, or an Array of event names.

items.name: fireAction
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action). By default, the action function will be executed after any "before" event handlers (as specified using the `order` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener), but before any other handlers are fired. This gives the "before" handlers an opportunity to cancel the event by returning `false`, and prevent the action function from being called. The action can also be configured to run after normal handlers, but before any "after" handlers (as specified using the `order` event option) by passing `'after'` as the `order` parameter. This configuration gives any event handlers except for "after" handlers the opportunity to cancel the event and prevent the action function from being called.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text: Event options for the action function. Accepts any of the options of Ext.util.Observable#addListener

items.name: order
items.text: The order to call the action function relative too the event handlers (`'before'` or `'after'`). Note that this option is simply used to sort the action function relative to the event handlers by "priority". An order of `'before'` is equivalent to a priority of `99.5`, while an order of `'after'` is equivalent to a priority of `-99.5`. See the `priority` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener for more details.

items.name: fireEvent
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name, plus the `options` object passed to Ext.util.Observable#addListener). An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventArgs
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameter list. An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: An array of parameters which are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventedAction
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action).
Evented Actions will automatically dispatch a 'before' event passing. This event will
be given a special controller that allows for pausing/resuming of the event flow.

By pausing the controller the updater and events will not run until resumed. Pausing,
however, will not stop the processing of any other before events.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: fnArgs
items.text:
Optional arguments for the action `fn`. If not
given, the normal `args` will be used to call `fn`. If `false` is passed, the
`args` are used but if the first argument is this instance it will be removed
from the args passed to the action function.

items.name: getBubbleParent
items.text: Gets the bubbling parent for an Observable
The bubble parent. null is returned if no bubble target exists

items.name: getCount
items.text: Returns the count of selected records.
The number of selected records

items.deprecatedMessage: This API uses column indices which include hidden columns in the count. Use getPosition instead.
items.name: getCurrentPosition
items.text: Returns the current position in the format {row: row, column: column}

items.name: getId
items.text: Retrieves the id of this component. Will autogenerate an id if one has not already been set.
id

items.name: getLastSelected
items.text: Called by Ext.panel.Table#updateBindSelection when publishing the `selection` property. It should yield the last record selected.

The last record selected. This is only available if the current selection type is cells or rows.
In the case of multiple selection, the *last* record added to the selection is returned.

items.name: getPosition
items.text: Returns the current position in the format {row: row, column: column}
A CellContext object describing the current cell.

items.name: getSelection
items.text: Returns an array of the currently selected records.
The selected records

items.name: getSelectionMode
items.text: Returns the current selectionMode.
The selectionMode: 'SINGLE', 'MULTI' or 'SIMPLE'.

items.name: getStore
items.text: Gets the current store instance.
The store, null if one does not exist.

items.name: getStoreListeners
items.text: Gets the listeners to bind to a new store.

items.name: store
items.text: The Store which is being bound to for which a listeners object should be returned.

The listeners to be bound to the store in object literal form. The scope
may be omitted, it is assumed to be the current instance.

items.name: hasListener
items.text:
Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event, or whether the event bubbles. The answer
indicates whether the event needs firing or not.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to check for
`true` if the event is being listened for or bubbles, else `false`

items.name: hasSelection
items.text: Returns true if there are any a selected records.

items.name: isLocked
items.text: Returns true if the selections are locked.

items.name: isRangeSelected
items.text: Returns true if the specified row is selected.

items.name: from
items.text: The start of the range to check.

items.name: to
items.text: The end of the range to check.

items.name: isSelected
items.text: Returns true if the specified row is selected.

items.name: record
items.text: The record or index of the record to check

items.name: isSuspended
items.text: Checks if all events, or a specific event, is suspended.

items.name: event
items.text: The name of the specific event to check
`true` if events are suspended

items.name: mon
items.text: Shorthand for addManagedListener.

items.name: mun
items.text: Shorthand for removeManagedListener.

items.name: onAfter
items.text: Appends an after-event handler. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBefore
items.text: Appends a before-event handler. Returning `false` from the handler will stop the event. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBindStore
items.text:
Template method, it is called when a new store is bound
to the current instance.

items.name: store
items.text: The store being bound

items.name: initial
items.text: True if this store is being bound as initialization of the instance.

items.name: onCellClick
items.text:
Set the current position based on where the user clicks.
IMPORTANT* Due to V4.0.0 history, the cellIndex here is the index within ALL columns, including hidden.

items.name: onColumnMove
items.text: When grid uses Ext.panel.Table#optimizedColumnMove (the default), this is added as a Ext.panel.Table#columnmove handler to correctly maintain the selected column using the same column header. If optimizedColumnMove === false, (which some grid Features set) then the view is refreshed, so this is not added as a handler because the selected column.

items.name: onHeaderClick
items.text: Called by the owning grid's Ext.grid.header.Container when a column header is activated by the UI (clicked, or receives a `SPACE` or `ENTER` key event).

items.name: onUnbindStore
items.text:
Template method, it is called when an existing store is unbound
from the current instance.

items.name: store
items.text: The store being unbound

items.name: initial
items.text: True if this store is being bound as initialization of the instance.

items.name: relayEvents
items.text:
Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by `this`.

For example if you are extending Grid, you might decide to forward some events from store.
So you can do this inside your initComponent:

    this.relayEvents(this.getStore(), ['load']);

The grid instance will then have an observable 'load' event which will be passed
the parameters of the store's load event and any function fired with the grid's
load event would have access to the grid using the this keyword (unless the event
is handled by a controller's control/listen event listener in which case 'this'
will be the controller rather than the grid).

items.name: origin
items.text: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

items.name: events
items.text:
Array of event names to relay or an Object with key/value
pairs translating to ActualEventName/NewEventName respectively. For example:
    this.relayEvents(this, {add:'push', remove:'pop'});

Would now redispatch the add event of this as a push event and the remove event as a pop event.

items.name: prefix
removeAfterListener
items.text: Alias for unAfter.

items.name: removeBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for unBefore.

items.name: removeListener
items.text: Removes an event handler.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The type of event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove. **This must be a reference to the function passed into the Ext.util.Observable#addListener call.**

items.name: scope
removeManagedListener
items.text: Removes listeners that were added by the mon method.

items.name: item
items.text: The item from which to remove a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the handler function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: removeManagedListenerItem
items.text: Remove a single managed listener item

items.name: isClear
items.text: True if this is being called during a clear

items.name: managedListener
items.text:
The managed listener item
See removeManagedListener for other args

items.name: resolveListenerScope
items.text:
Gets the default scope for firing late bound events (string names with
no scope attached) at runtime.

items.name: defaultScope
items.text: The default scope to return if none is found.
The default event scope

items.name: resumeEvent
items.text: Resumes firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to resume events, the events will fire when requested to fire. **Note that if the suspendEvent method is called multiple times for a certain event, this converse method will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to resume.

items.name: resumeEvents
items.text: Resumes firing events (see suspendEvents). If events were suspended using the `queueSuspended` parameter, then all events fired during event suspension will be sent to any listeners now.

items.name: discardQueue
items.text: `true` to prevent any previously queued events from firing while we were suspended. See suspendEvents.

items.name: select
pos
items.text: An object with row and column properties

items.name: row
items.text: A record or index of the record (starting at 0)

items.name: column
items.text: A column or index of the column (starting at 0).  Includes visible columns only.

items.name: selectAll
items.text: Selects all records in the view.

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: True to suppress any select events

items.name: selectByPosition
items.text: Used internally by CellEditing

items.name: selectRange
items.text: Selects a range of rows if the selection model isLocked. All rows in between startRow and endRow are also selected.

items.name: startRow
items.text: The record or index of the first row in the range

items.name: endRow
items.text: The record or index of the last row in the range

items.name: keepExisting
items.text: (optional) True to retain existing selections

items.deprecatedMessage: This API uses column indices which include hidden columns in the count. Use setPosition instead.
items.name: setCurrentPosition
items.text: Sets the current position.

items.name: position
items.text: The position to set. May be an object of the form `{row:1, column:2}`

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: True to suppress selection events

items.name: setListeners
items.text: An alias for Ext.util.Observable#addListener. In versions prior to 5.1, listeners had a generated setter which could be called to add listeners. In 5.1 the listeners config is not processed using the config system and has no generated setter, so this method is provided for backward compatibility. The preferred way of adding listeners is to use the on method.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The listeners

items.name: setLocked
items.text: Locks the current selection and disables any changes from happening to the selection.

items.name: locked
items.text: True to lock, false to unlock.

items.name: setPosition
items.text:
Sets the current position.

Note that if passing a column index, it is the index within the *visible* column set.

items.name: position
items.text: The position to set. May be an object of the form `{row:1, column:2}`

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: True to suppress selection events

items.name: setSelectionMode
items.text: Sets the current selectionMode.

items.name: selMode
items.text: 'SINGLE', 'MULTI' or 'SIMPLE'.

items.name: setStore
items.text: Sets the store to the specified store.

items.name: suspendEvent
items.text: Suspends firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to suspend events, the events will no longer fire when requested to fire. **Note that if this is called multiple times for a certain event, the converse method resumeEvent will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to suspend.

items.name: suspendEvents
items.text: Suspends the firing of all events. (see resumeEvents)

items.name: queueSuspended
items.text: `true` to queue up suspended events to be fired after the resumeEvents call instead of discarding all suspended events.

items.name: un
items.text: Shorthand for removeListener.

items.name: unAfter
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unBefore
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unbindStoreListeners
items.text:
Unbinds listeners from this component to the store. By default it will remove
anything bound by the bindStoreListeners method, however it can be overridden
in a subclass to provide any more complicated handling.

items.name: store
items.text: The store to unbind from

items.name: updateSelectedInstances
items.text: Called when the store is refreshed. Selected records which are no longer present in the store are removed if pruneRemoved is `true`. Selected records which are still present have their instances in the passed collection updated.

items.name: selected
items.text: A Collection representing the currently selected records.

items.name: vetoSelection
items.text:
Checks whether a selection should proceed based on the ignoreRightMouseSelection
option.

items.name: e
items.text: The event
`true` if the selection should not proceed.

items.name: $eventOptions
items.text: Matches options property names within a listeners specification object  - property names which are never used as event names.

items.name: eventsSuspended
items.text: Initial suspended call count. Incremented when suspendEvents is called, decremented when resumeEvents is called.

items.name: factoryConfig
items.text: If this property is specified by the target class of this mixin its properties are used to configure the created Ext.Factory.

items.name: hasListeners
items.text: This object holds a key for any event that has a listener. The listener may be set directly on the instance, or on its class or a super class (via observe) or on the Ext.app.EventBus. The values of this object are truthy (a non-zero number) and falsy (0 or undefined). They do not represent an exact count of listeners. The value for an event is truthy if the event must be fired and is falsy if there is no need to fire the event. The intended use of this property is to avoid the expense of fireEvent calls when there are no listeners. This can be particularly helpful when one would otherwise have to call fireEvent hundreds or thousands of times. It is used like this: if (this.hasListeners.foo) { this.fireEvent('foo', this, arg1); }

items.name: isObservable
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Observable, or subclass thereof.

items.name: isSelectionModel
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Ext.selection.Model, or subclass thereof.

items.name: selected
items.text: A MixedCollection that maintains all of the currently selected records.
